body_html:
@tfboyd I just tried with new dilated conv API and now it does show the correct shape inference.

input_tensor = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (10, None, 256, 3))

dilated = tf.nn.conv2d(input_tensor,
                            tf.zeros((3, 1, 3, 16)),
                            strides=[1,1,1,1],
                            dilations=[1, 2, 1, 1],
                            padding='SAME')

print(dilated.get_shape())

I'm not sure how to fix the shape inference for convolution() though.
body_text:
@tfboyd I just tried with new dilated conv API and now it does show the correct shape inference.
input_tensor = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (10, None, 256, 3))

dilated = tf.nn.conv2d(input_tensor,
                            tf.zeros((3, 1, 3, 16)),
                            strides=[1,1,1,1],
                            dilations=[1, 2, 1, 1],
                            padding='SAME')

print(dilated.get_shape())

I'm not sure how to fix the shape inference for convolution() though.
body:
@tfboyd I just tried with new dilated conv API and now it does show the correct shape inference.

```
input_tensor = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (10, None, 256, 3))

dilated = tf.nn.conv2d(input_tensor,
                            tf.zeros((3, 1, 3, 16)),
                            strides=[1,1,1,1],
                            dilations=[1, 2, 1, 1],
                            padding='SAME')

print(dilated.get_shape())
```
I'm not sure how to fix the shape inference for convolution() though.
